required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 3 Dimensional Ultrasound in Comparison to Hysteroscopy in Myomas
clinical_study.official_title: 3 Dimensional Ultrasound in Comparison to Hysteroscopy in Diagnosis of Myomas

brief_summary.textblock: • three-dimensional saline infusion sonohysterography (3D SIS) was performed in all cases. A sterile Cuscoe speculum was passed, the cervix visualized and cleaned with sterile chlorhexidine solution. A 3.3 mm soft plastic paediatric naso-gastric suction catheter was then passed through the cervix into the uterine cavity without grasping the cervix.

detailed_description.textblock: The speculum was removed and a 5 MHz transvaginal 3D ultrasound probe inserted into the vagina (Voluson 730; KretzTechnik, Austria).

primary_outcome.measure: The accuracy of 3D ultrasound in doiagnosis of submucous myomas in comparison to hysteroscopy
primary_outcome.description: How many women will be diagnosed by 3D US to have submucous myoma

arm_group.arm_group_label: 3D ultrasound for diagnosis of submucous myomas
Hysteroscopy for diagnosis of submucous myoma

intervention.description: Doing 3D ultrasound for diagnosis of submucous myoma
intervention.arm_group_label: 3D ultrasound for diagnosis of submucous myomas

intervention.description: Doing hysteroscopy for diagnosis of submucous myoma
intervention.arm_group_label: Hysteroscopy for diagnosis of submucous myoma

study_pop.textblock: Women between 20 and 60 years with abnormal uterine bleeding

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- • Women between 20 and 60 years with abnormal uterine bleeding in form of heavy menstrual bleeding, irregular and heavy menstrual bleeding) diagnosed on non-enhanced two-dimensional ultrasonography with submucous fibroids.
- Absence of STD, PID, active vaginal bleeding.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of general cause of abnormal uterine bleeding
- History of drug use that can cause vaginal bleeding (anticoagulants, OCPs, HRT)
- History of recent hormonal treatment
- High risk of undergoing hysteroscopy
- Vaginal, Vulval causes of bleeding
